Description: Rim and neck fragment of South Ionian Fikellura pottery amphora; interior, black save band on the edge of rim; exterior, from neck downwards glazed black; neck reserved and decorated with frieze of verticals.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by Antikenmuseum, Heidelberg. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 126-7, no. Nau 90, pl. 21, fig. a)
CVA Heidelberg I / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Heidelberg Universität Band I (p. 11, no. 22, pl. 2, no. 22.)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.070)
